moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Bd3:
not the usual lines.
basically, I think that not following the main lines in openings is not so good - especially for low rated players. I think one should go with the rules that grater has seen and annotated before. In a game of low rated players it will be hard to prove ones strength in positional play when you go out of theory so early in the game.
moves.3... c5: I dont know the theory says here but it seems to me that d:e4 B:e4 Kf6 makes the Bishop move another move and that's 3 moves with the same piece in the early opening. that can't be good for white.
moves.4. Bb5+: second move with the same piece. exd5 exd5 dxc5 Bxc5 and to play against the isolated pawn seems reasonable.
moves.4... Nc6 5. Nf3 Bd7: 5... dxe4 6. Ng4 Nf6 etc. should be checked carefuly. it might be a good choice for black.
moves.6. O-O Bd6: I dont like that move. e5 is a problem for black.
moves.7. Be3:
why not e5?
after 7... Be7 8. c3 f6 9. exf6 Nxf6 10. Re1 - there are problems for black.
moves.7... a6 8. Bxc6: a must. going back with the bishop seems to be bad.
moves.8... Bxc6 9. e5 Bc7 10. c3: white managed to pass e5 and to create a chain of soldiers. it looks good.
moves.10... cxd4 11. Nxd4:
I dont get it. is there a tactical punch that I'm missing?
why leaving the e5 pawn helpless?
moves.11... Ne7:
now I saw it.
11.... Bxe5 12. Nxe6!? fxe6 13. Qh5+ g6 14. Qxe5 Qf6.
is that realy that bad?
moves.12. Nd2 O-O 13. Bf4 Ng6: White's tactical tryout made the e5 pawn a target for attack. its true it can be protected but the question is: for how long?
moves.14. Nxc6 bxc6 15. Qg4 Bxe5: and the pawn goes - with white's small advantage.
moves.16. Bxe5 Nxe5 17. Qg3 Ng6: after it clears - Black is a pawn up and there is a great center play for him. white is a bit out of the game...
moves.18. Nf3 Rb8 19. b3 Qf6: Black is pressing on white's weak points: firdt b2 and now c3.
moves.20. Rac1 Rb7 21. Rfe1 Rfb8: the plan is good. there has to be a try to push the a pawn or the c pawn or both.
